messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

Imagine a world with twelve rooms. From the lobby you have two choices, room 1 and room 2. You enter room 1, at the end there's a door that leads to room 3, and room 3 leads to room 5. There is a door in room 5 that leads to room 7 and room 7 leads to room 9. From room 9 you can enter room 11. There's a chest in room 11. You open it and there is 10 dollars, but you do not take any money, you're just learning about the environment. Then you exit and start over. This time in the lobby you choose room 2, then enter room 4, which leads to room 6. There is a door in room 6 that leads to room 8 and room 8 leads to room 10. At the end there is a door that leads to room 12. There's a chest with 50 dollars in room 12, but you do not take any money, you're just learning about the environment. You return to the lobby. You will only be able to choose one path that leads to the most money.  Starting from the lobby, which path will lead to the most money?  Please list all room numbers in order, separated by commas

, and ending with the most money.

Start Training
In the meantime, explore other trainings.

Explore other trainings, all designed to help you prepare for certification and succeed in your career.

This collection of courses will introduce you to IBM Watson™ Assistant, which is a smart virtual agent that you can interact with using natural language. You'll be able to create a Watson Assistant chatbot on IBM Cloud that uses data from the Weather Company to respond to common queries. You'll also learn about conversational AI, how Watson Assistant processes conversations, and how you can apply it to real-world problems.

IBM is the global leader in business transformation through an open hybrid cloud platform and AI, serving clients in more than 170 countries around the world. Today 47 of the Fortune 50 Companies rely on the IBM Cloud to run their business, and IBM Watson enterprise AI is hard at work in more than 30,

For more than seven decades, IBM Middle East & Pakistan has played a vital role in shaping the information technology landscape of the region. Today, IBM is part of the region's technological fabric, solving real-world business and societal challenges, through its offices across UAE, Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Kuwait and Pakistan, and also a diversity of centers across the region.

IBM has established deep rooted collaborations with leading technology leaders such as SAP, Apple, Ericsson, Microsoft, Cisco, EMC, VMware and many others. IBM also has strategic agreements with local players such as Mobily, Saudi Telecom, Zain and Etisalat.

IBM's footprint of innovation in the region is represented by numerous centers of excellence, some of which are: the IBM Software Lab in Saudi Arabia, IBM Research Lab in Dubai, IBM Systems Lab in Saudi Arabia and IBM Services
